title: Technical Debt vs Feature Request
description: The PM has prioritized a new feature that users are requesting. However, you've identified critical technical debt that's causing 20% of user bugs. The refactor would take 2 weeks, same as the feature. The PM is pushing for the feature to ship this sprint.

choices.text: Advocate strongly for the refactor first, explaining the long-term impact of technical debt
Ship the feature but document the technical debt as a blocker for next sprint
Work extra hours to do both this sprint

title: Scope Creep Mid-Sprint
description: You're midway through a sprint when the founder asks you to add 'one small feature' to the current release. It's not smallâ€”it would require rearchitecting part of your solution. The team is already stretched.

choices.text: Push back firmly and explain the engineering implications
Accept the request but cut corners to make it work
Propose a minimal version that fits within current architecture
